<<<<<<< HEAD
No king but the old kings son. Or, a vindication of limited monarchy, as it was established in this nation, before the late war between the King and Parliament.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed for Theophilus Microcosmus, London : Anno Dom. 1660.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "March. 23. 1659"; the '60' in imprint date is crossed out. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
